review: I recommend this to all.  This product revolutionized the way I watch YouTube and Netflix.  I control them via my Samsung Galaxy S4  and that is way easier to use than my TV remote!
author: Amazon Customer "jfalkens"

review: Love this little cheap device! Works great to stream from my computer or for Netflix streaming! Can't wait for some more apps to work with it as well!
author: Charles B. Cianciolo IV

review: Perhaps not as feature rich as other products on the market, yet I find it so easy to control the content discovery from my phone and just share it on the big screen. Once local content is enabled this device will be complete.
author: PeteF

review: I've only had this for a day now. But easy set up and easy to use. Works good from my phone.

author: Timmy Nguyen

review: In ten minutes you will be up and running from your laptop, notebook or smart phone. Show you photos, movies facebook on the wide screen.  If you have a usb port on your TV then you won't even have to have external power.  Instant Netflex. If you have great internet service then you can feed the TV, and watch 4-8 screens of a NASCAR race at the same time.  While on another laptop watching a netflex movie.  The software is totally automatic once you go to there (Google Chromecast) website.  Buy it you will love it.
author: Shipping Monitor "JR"

review: Works very well with Netflix and Youtube, setting it up was very easy. Really wish Redbox and Amazon Instant Video would supported today, maybe one day.
author: Justin W

review: CHROMECAST: I purchased Google's new toy. The first problem is compatibility. It will not work with Windows XP so the tower in the living room will not work with it. My Amazon Kindle uses Google's operating system but it will not work any way. I tried to install it on my AT&T; Samsung Galaxy III that uses the Android operating system but could not get it to work. The only place it works is on my Samsung laptop with Windows 7 but only with the Google Chrome browser.Then a message pops up saying that using Chromecast can degrade the video. It is true. Some video sources are OK but if the original is not the best  or if the server can not keep up with the buffering it is worse.
author: Jerry W. Cluney

review: I was very disappointed that the chrome cast was not applicable with other websites. Also, i could not get it to work with my Samsung galaxy s2 phone. It specifically stated on the box that you can send video or anything on the web to your tv from your smartphone,tablet or laptop. However, I can set up you tube on my iPad to stream to my Tv.
author: C. Ching

review: Waited quite a while to get the item and I am somewhat disapointed. It only supports netflix, chrome, and youtube. I thought it would be more flexible. Another thing that annoyed me was once I got it set up and working the video/audio did not match and I didn't want to change to a lower resolution. After I took the unit out of the TV and tried watching some videos I recorded from dish I wouldn't allow me to. Said something about HDCP.I guess for netflix subscribers it would be ok but a lot of work needs to be done.
author: Dave T
